info.name: Trello API
info.description:
### Trello API collection

The API of my choice is Trello. Having used Jira API previously I thought it would be interesting to have a look at another Atlassian product. 
 <https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/trello/rest/api-group-actions/>

For this collection I started by creating an environment which I named: TrelloEnvironment.
Then I created global variables that include: The API key, token, secret and endpoint. 
The collection includes four separate files that contain the requests related to: 
* Logging 
* Fetching protected data 
* Creating protected data 
*  Updating protected data.

I have run an API collection test which show a positive outcome.

In each file you will find a documented process including examples of the results.

request.description:
#### Authetification
I have been researching a way to access to the app with the credentials but I wasn't successful doing it. This is an example that would be used to allow a third party app to get access to the users account. I followed the documentation available here: <https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/trello/guides/rest-api/api-introduction/>

response.name: Logging to Trello

header.value: x-rate-limit-api-key-interval-ms, x-rate-limit-api-key-max, x-rate-limit-api-key-remaining, x-rate-limit-api-token-interval-ms, x-rate-limit-api-token-max, x-rate-limit-api-token-remaining

response.body:
Would you like to give the following application access to your account?

MyPersonalToken


MyPersonalToken will be able to use your account until you disable it.

MyPersonalToken is not affiliated with Trello, and by permitting access to your content you assume all related risks and liabilities.

MyPersonalToken will be able to:
  • Read your name and username
  • Read your Enterprises
  • Read all of your boards and Workspaces
  • Read your Workspace's Power-Ups

MyPersonalToken will not be able to:
  • Make comments as you
  • Read your email address
  • See your Trello password
  • Update and manage your Enterprises
  • Create and update cards, lists, boards and Workspaces
  • Update your Workspace's Power-Ups

Trello's Privacy Policy

Log in
Created a day ago
Used by 0 members

item.name: Fetching protected data (GET)

request.description: This request allows you to list your boards.

#### Get Board

The GET board request, retrieves data from a specific board. In this case I choose to work on a board Template.

The code bellow is the test that retrieves the board id that will be stored in the environment variables.
```
var jsonData = JSON.parse(responseBody);
postman.setEnvironmentVariable("pboard_id", jsonData.id);
```

response.name: Get Board

header.value: x-rate-limit-api-key-interval-ms, x-rate-limit-api-key-max, x-rate-limit-api-key-remaining, x-rate-limit-api-token-interval-ms, x-rate-limit-api-token-max, x-rate-limit-api-token-remaining

request.description:
#### Get Lists
The GET lists request, retrieves data from the lists available in the "Sprint Retrospectives" board.

The code bellow is the test that retrieves a list id that will be stored in the environment variables.

```
var jsonData = JSON.parse(responseBody);
postman.setEnvironmentVariable("plist_id", jsonData.id);
```

request.description:
#### GET Members from cards

This request retrieves the members that created and worked on a specific card.

header.value: x-rate-limit-api-key-interval-ms, x-rate-limit-api-key-max, x-rate-limit-api-key-remaining, x-rate-limit-api-token-interval-ms, x-rate-limit-api-token-max, x-rate-limit-api-token-remaining

item.description:
### Fetching Data

This file is dedicated to retieve informations from a public board in Trello: " Sprint Retrospectives". 

To access different elements, I stored the board Id in a variable. The other variables are stored by running the collection test.

item.name: Creating protected data (POST)

request.description:
#### POST Board

This POST request will create a new "Daon Kanban Board" in Trello.

#### POST list

This POST request will create a new list in the previously created board. To create this list the board Id is a required parameter.
The board id is retrieved from the stored collection variable board_id.

item.name: Create a new card in a list
Create a checklist on a card

request.description:
#### POST Checklist

Create a new checklist on a card

url.raw: https://api.trello.com/1/cards/{{card_id}}/actions/comments?key={{Trello Key}}&token={{Trello Token}}&text=This is a dummy comment to test the card comment

query.value: This is a dummy comment to test the card comment

item.description:
#### Create elements in Trello
This file is dedicated to create different elements in Trello. The idea is to create a micro project management board. 

This board will include a list, a card and some other elements linked to the cards: such as comment and a checklist.

item.name: Updating protected data (PUT)

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/1/boards/{{board_id}}?key={{Trello Key}}&token={{Trello Token}}&labelNames/green=Done&labelNames/red=Critical&labelNames/orange=Urgent&labelNames/yellow=Waiting for feedback&labelNames/blue=On Production Server&labelNames/purple=Has to be discussed

request.description:
By running this request you will re-name the labels on the board.

The colors are represented as follows:
* Green: Done
* Red: Critical
* Orange: Urgent
* Yellow: Waiting for feedback
* Blue: On Production Server
* Purple: Has to be discussed

item.name: Update a list on a board

request.description:
#### PUT list

In this request, an update has been committed to the list that was created previously. The element that is updated is the value of subscribed: Whether the active member is subscribed to this list.

item.name: Update a card in a list

request.description:
#### PUT Card

I updated the name of the previously created Card. When creating a card through the API the name is not required, so for the purpose of testing the PUT request I have update the name which was an empty property.

item.name: Update a checklist on a card

request.description:
#### PUT Checklists
I updated the checklist name to: Daily Tasks

item.description:
#### Updating elements from the (POST) file 

This file contains the requests that update the created items. I made sure to use a similar structure to the POST file.
